examples: He fouled his own nest by wrongly accusing his boss.

They wrongly believed the war could have been won if the army hadn't been betrayed by politicians and protesters.
This legislation reformed sentencing laws that have wrongly and disproportionately harmed the African-American community.
And we know that motivation can play a role in other things, like your grades and your career path, that could be wrongly chalked up to just an IQ score.
words.defineEn: in a mistaken or incorrect way
words.defineVi: trong một cách sai lầm hoặc không chính xác

examples: Just click the link below.
She had a scar just below her knee from a childhood bike accident.
They are all equally below the salt.
The cliff dropped down over a hundred feet to the sea below.
I know she really wants the promotion, but she really hit me below the belt by telling the boss about my personal problems.
words.defineEn: in a lower level, position, or place
words.defineVi: ở cấp độ thấp hơn, vị trí hoặc địa điểm

examples: Take two from ten.
Two could play at that game, smart guy.
The twins have two bicycles.
Two faces appeared at our window.
Better one house spoiled than two.
words.defineEn: the number 2; the number of wheels on a bicycle
words.defineVi: số 2; số lượng bánh xe trên một chiếc xe đạp

examples: A work ill done must be twice done.
"I've done twice as much today as yesterday!"
You won't have to explain it to him twice.
These foods are potentially dangerous, yet nobody thinks twice before handing them out to their loved ones.
The dentist recommended that I brush my teeth twice a day and floss regularly.
words.defineEn: for two times
words.defineVi: hai lần

examples: The boat hit against an object under the surface of the water.
The waves drove against the shore.
The body's immune system protects against harmful bacteria and viruses.
Someone has stacked the cards against me.
She pressed her cheek against the cool glass window.
words.defineEn: in opposition to someone or something
words.defineVi: đối lập với một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: The teacher called out our names one by one for attendance.
A hundred cents make one euro.
The Maasai tribe is one of the indigenous tribes of Africa.
The appointment of a woman was one in the eye for male domination.
Neither one seems like the sharpest pencil in the box.
words.defineEn: the number 1; the number of sun in the sky
words.defineVi: số 1; số mặt trời trên bầu trời

examples: A stream of black cars drove by.
A stream of black cars drove by.
The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
By making her jump through the hoops?
The chef impressed the customers by his special dish of button mushrooms with crumbled feta cheese.
words.defineEn: indicating the means of doing or achieving something
words.defineVi: chỉ ra các phương tiện để làm hoặc đạt được một cái gì đó

examples: After all, one case of the trots hardly spells disaster.
Every age has its book, after all.
After all, love will find a way.
After all, an electrical brain is smarter than the sum of its parts.
A new broom sweeps clean, after all.
words.defineEn: at a later time
words.defineVi: sau đó

examples: A large bus was sitting outside.
The temperature outside is nineteen degrees Celsius.
The trail starts just outside the town.
The children are playing outside in the park.
Two huge fountains were playing outside the entrance.
words.defineEn: not inside a building or room
words.defineVi: không ở bên trong một tòa nhà hoặc phòng

examples: The dog has gone inside.
She knows the business inside out.
He accidentally put his underwear on inside out.
A lot has happened inside these four walls.
She reached inside her bag for a pen.
words.defineEn: in or into a room or building; within a building
words.defineVi: trong hoặc vào một căn phòng hoặc tòa nhà; trong một tòa nhà

examples: The actress was practicing her lines before the audition.
Her life had always run smoothly before.
We have had these mysteries before.
Have you ever used this software before?
The case was tried before a jury.
words.defineEn: at an earlier time
words.defineVi: tại một thời điểm sớm hơn

examples: With a sharp knife, the chef expertly removed the gristle from the pork chops.
Fast food chains removed pink slime from their menus to regain trust.
The baker skillfully removed the stone from the apricot, preparing it for a delicious pie.
They carefully removed the exocarp of the pomegranate, revealing the clusters of vibrant red arils inside.
I carefully removed the seed coat of the pumpkin seed before roasting it for a tasty snack.
words.defineEn: to take off an item of clothing, glasses, etc.
words.defineVi: để cởi bỏ một mặt hàng quần áo, kính, vv

examples: the company's new policy purports to reduce its carbon footprint.
You can reduce the bitterness of sour gourd by soaking it in saltwater before cooking.
The heavy rain created a thick curtain of water, reducing visibility on the road.
The government took action to reduce unemployment rates.
We will have to adjust to our reduced circumstances.
words.defineEn: to make something less or smaller in amount, degree, price, etc.
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó ít hơn hoặc nhỏ hơn về số lượng, mức độ, giá cả, vv

examples: They also rated their own abilities higher.
Stocks climbed higher on Wall Street today.
And back in this country, gains in the technology sector pushed stocks higher on Wall Street today.
I might even go higher.
That's a level of magnitude higher.
words.defineEn: having a greater level or degree in position, value, rank, importance, or quality.
words.defineVi: có trình độ hoặc mức độ lớn hơn về vị trí, giá trị, cấp bậc, tầm quan trọng hoặc phẩm chất.

examples: She moved the ball toward the opponent's goal.
He walked toward the park.
Her behavior toward her colleagues was unprofessional.
She worked hard toward her degree.
They learned from their mistakes and used them as stepping stones toward success.
words.defineEn: in the direction of someone or something
words.defineVi: theo hướng của một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: They topped fruit tarts with mango coulis.
The fish tacos were topped with tangy slaw and creamy sauce.
This dictionary goes on the top shelf.
We topped our baked potatoes with a generous drizzle of bechamel sauce.
Write your name at the top of the paper.
words.defineEn: the point or part of something that is the highest
words.defineVi: điểm hoặc một phần của một cái gì đó là cao nhất

examples: Together, the ant colony was greater than the sum of its parts.
They play the guitar together during jam sessions.
The family took a vacation together, creating wonderful memories with their children.
They did everything together.
They stayed together for the sake of the children.
words.defineEn: near to or with something or someone else
words.defineVi: gần hoặc với một cái gì đó hoặc người khác

examples: They both pay their employees badly.
This company badly needs to bring in some new blood.
The evening started badly when the speaker failed to turn up.
We've done very badly as far as planning is concerned.
Jack vented his spleen at his wife whenever things went badly at work.
words.defineEn: to a great or serious degree or extent
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ lớn hoặc nghiêm trọng hoặc mức độ

examples: Trains between London and Brighton run throughout the day.
Responsibility is shared between parents and teachers.
This collection of stories bridges the gap between history and fiction.
This book bridges a gulf between the metaphysics literature and philosophy of mind literature.
His incorrect translation of the phrase caused a misunderstanding between the two parties.
words.defineEn: in, into, or at the space that is separating two things, places, or people
words.defineVi: trong, vào hoặc tại không gian ngăn cách hai sự vật, địa điểm hoặc con người

examples: She raised both arms above her head.
The articles in this magazine are a cut above the others.
John stands head and shoulders above Bob.
The deal was completely open and above board.
Singapore punches above its weight in the world economy.
words.defineEn: in, at, or to a higher position
words.defineVi: ở, tại, hoặc đến một vị trí cao hơn

examples: The average worker spends about two hours a day wasting time.
The basic pay of the average worker has risen by 3 per cent.
Profit and dividend growth looks like being above average for the foreseeable future.
He believes the average consumer is being led down the garden path by the promises in advertisements.
On average, people consume three meals per day: breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
words.defineEn: calculated by adding a set of numbers together and dividing this amount by the total number of amounts in that set
words.defineVi: được tính bằng cách cộng một tập hợp các số lại với nhau và chia số tiền này cho tổng số tiền trong tập hợp đó

examples: She was extremely sick, but we were waiting for a raindrop in the drought.
We were made to feel extremely welcome.
He's extremely irritable - he flies off the handle at the slightest thing.
The Prime Minister is understood to have been extremely angry about the report.
It was a small problem and she has been treated extremely badly.
words.defineEn: to a very great amount or degree
words.defineVi: đến một số lượng rất lớn hoặc mức độ

examples: Small cracks appeared in the wall.
That holiday cost me a small fortune.
This small restaurant is the best pound for pound in the city.
The whole may be smaller than the sum of its parts!
I gave a small donation.
words.defineEn: little or below average in size, amount, degree, etc.
words.defineVi: ít hoặc dưới mức trung bình về kích thước, số lượng, mức độ, v.v.

examples: Last year's winners again have the championship firmly in their pocket.
Then again, some major thinkers are way ahead of the curve.
Their bank account was in the red again.
Go over it again.
She again told tales out of school.
words.defineEn: once more; one more time
words.defineVi: một lần nữa; một lần nữa
